description: The regime has accused opposition leader María Corina Machado of a plot to alter voting results.
title: Venezuela Erupts in Protests as Maduro Reclaims Office: Photos

description: US President Joe Biden has called on Congress to pass enforceable rules of conduct for justices of the Supreme Court as part of a larger proposal to overhaul the institution by imposing term limits. The court adopted a code of conduct for the first time in November, but it lacks an enforcement mechanism. It took up the code after justices Clarence Thomas and Samuel Alito came under scrutiny for alleged ethical lapses.
title: What’s Behind Biden’s Call for Changes to US Supreme Court

description: Marianne Williamson said she failed to meet the deadline to challenge Vice President Kamala Harris for the Democratic nomination, effectively ending her longshot bid.
title: Marianne Williamson Ends Longshot 2024 Presidential Bid

description: Brazil is in negotiations with Mexico and Colombia to publish a joint statement demanding that Venezuela count all votes and release ballot records from each precinct, according to two Brazilian government officials familiar with the matter.
title: Brazil, Mexico, Colombia Negotiating Joint Statement on Venezuela Election Transparency

description: Opponents of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's government clash with riot police during a protest in the Catia neighborhood of Caracas on July 29, 2024.
title: Venezuela’s Contested Election Result Sparks Protests

description: Hundreds of Venezuelans have taken to the streets to protest what they say is a fraudulent win by President Nicolás Maduro, the longtime socialist leader who presided over the country’s economic collapse.
title: Protests Erupt Across Caracas After Maduro Claims Reelection

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics and influence reporter Ted Mann looks at how President Joe Biden is being eclipsed. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Is Still President But Finds Himself Playing Second Fiddle

description: Colombia’s Interior Minister Juan Fernando Cristo called for an independent verification of the voting tallies in the Venezuelan presidential election.
title: Colombia Minister Joins Calls for Verification of Venezuela Vote

description: Russia, China and Iran are all recruiting Americans to spread propaganda advancing their interests ahead of the US presidential election, American intelligence officials said Monday.
title: Russia, Iran, China All Seek to Shape US Election, Officials Say

description: The US will determine future sanctions on Venezuela based on whether President Nicolas Maduro’s government fully releases voting data from the country’s disputed election over the weekend, according to senior Biden administration officials.
title: US to Weigh Venezuela Vote Transparency on Future Sanctions

description: The UK government reached a deal with the British Medical Association to raise pay for junior doctors by as much as 24.6% over two years to end 15 months of strikes in Britain’s National Health Service.
title: UK Makes Pay Offer to Junior Doctors in Bid to End Strikes

description: Venezuela named opposition leader María Corina Machado as a key suspect in its investigation of alleged electoral sabotage in Sunday’s presidential vote, a move against a popular figure who rallied millions of supporters to the polls.
title: Venezuela Accuses Opposition Leader of Election Sabotage

description: The next leader of an obscure, UN-affiliated agency will help determine the fate of a potentially multibillion-dollar industry seeking to extract EV battery metals from the seabed.
title: The Future of Deep Sea Mining Hinges on a Contentious Election

description: The Golan Heights is a piece of high ground in one of the most conflict-prone places on Earth. That’s made it a focus of global dispute since Israel seized the plateau from Syria in the 1967 Middle East War. In the latest flareup there, a rocket attack from Lebanon killed 12 civilians at a football field and risked triggering the all-out war between Israel and the Lebanese militia Hezbollah that’s been looming for months.
title: What are the Golan Heights? The Disputed Territory, Explained

description: Nicolás Maduro is trying to ride out international skepticism about his declaration of victory in Venezuela, with all eyes turning to how aggressively he responds the opposition’s claim he stole the election.
title: Maduro’s Next Move Is Key With US and Brazil Questioning His Victory

description: US President Joe Biden’s administration backed the early extension of a program that will enable more than 30 sub-Saharan African nations to retain their duty-free access to the world’s biggest economy, an envoy said.
title: US Backs Early Extension of Trade Pact With Africa, Envoy Says

description: The UK won’t pursue a plan to sell some of its £6 billion ($8 billion) stake in NatWest Group Plc to the public, after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves concluded it didn’t provide value for money.
title: UK Cancels Plan to Sell NatWest Stake to the British Public

description: Rachel Reeves announced a slew of measures to shore up the UK’s public finances as she accused the previous Conservative government of running up a £22 billion ($28.3 billion) black hole, and signaled she may raise taxes at a budget at the end of October to help balance the books.
title: Reeves Opens Door to UK Tax Rises to Fill £22 Billion Black Hole

description: A larger share of companies operating in Mexico are feeling positive about security, according to a new report from the American Chamber of Commerce of Mexico.
title: Mexico Feels Safer Than Before, Executives Say in Survey

description: Former President Donald Trump has agreed to be interviewed by the FBI for the investigation into the July 13 assassination attempt at a rally in Pennsylvania.
title: Trump Agrees to Be Interviewed by FBI in Shooter Investigation

description: The Pentagon isn’t giving Congress and the public a full assessment of its difficulties and challenges developing hypersonic weapons to counter those already deployed by China and Russia, according to congressional auditors.
title: Pentagon Holding Back on Hypersonic Weapons’ Troubles, GAO Says

description: Israel’s military police said it raided a prison holding detainees from the Gaza war following allegations an inmate was subject to “serious abuse,” a move criticized by some members of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s ruling coalition.
title: Israel Army Raids Jail for Gaza-War Suspects on Abuse Claim

description: Guinea’s junta has blocked a series of protests planned by pro-democracy groups after some media organizations were forced to shut and two activists went missing.
title: Guinea Junta Blocks Protests Planned by Pro-Democracy Activists

description: Six Members of Parliament will battle to replace former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak as leader of the UK Conservatives, with the task of resurrecting the party from its worst ever electoral defeat.
title: Conservative Party Runners and Riders: The Six Candidates to Lead Britain’s Opposition

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said he “will not give up fiscal responsibility,” in comments broadcast on radio and TV Sunday night. “Among the many life lessons I received from my mother, Mrs. Lindu, I learned not to spend more than I earn,” Lula said, without alluding to any cuts in expenditures.
title: Brazil’s Lula Vows to Maintain Fiscal Responsibility

description: Armed police have detained a man and seized a knife after number of people were injured in a reported stabbing near Liverpool.
title: Man Detained, Knife Seized After a Number of People Injured in Southport Stabbing

description: South Africa’s African National Congress expelled former leader Jacob Zuma for starting a rival political group that cost the party its parliamentary majority for the first time since it came to power three decades ago.
title: South Africa’s ANC Expels Zuma Over Formation of Rival Party

description: Russian billionaire Petr Aven’s estate manager has agreed to forfeit more than £750,000 ($963,260) to end a near-two year investigation by British police over sanctions dodging.
title: Russian Billionaire’s Estate Forfeits Thousands to End UK Sanctions Case

description: Nigeria is running short of fuel ahead of nationwide demonstrations over the country’s cost-of-living crisis that are scheduled to begin Thursday.
title: Nigeria Fuel Runs Short Before National Cost-of-Living Protests

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni offered to broker better trade relations between China and the European Union, calling on President Xi Jinping to “balance out” commercial relations between the bloc and the world’s second-biggest economy.
title: Meloni Stakes Out Mediator Role in Balancing EU-China Relations

description: President Xi Jinping is stepping up efforts to position himself as a peacemaker for ending Russia’s war in Ukraine, despite growing criticisms from the US and Europe that Beijing is propping up the Kremlin’s battlefield efforts.
title: China Seizes Chance to Play Peacemaker in Ukraine Before US Vote

description: Germany called on its citizens in Lebanon to urgently leave the country as tensions grow after Israel blamed Hezbollah for an attack that killed several children in the Golan Heights.
title: Germany Urges Its Citizens to Leave Lebanon After Golan Strike

description: More than two dozen mercenaries from Russia’s Wagner Group and Malian soldiers were killed last week while fighting rebels in northern Mali, according to a pro-Kremlin news source, suffering what’s likely the group’s biggest death toll since it deployed to the West African country in 2021.
title: Russia’s Wagner Suffers Most Casualties Since Deploying to Mali

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un’s preteen daughter is receiving lessons to take over the country, South Korea’s spy agency told lawmakers, in a rapid elevation for the girl who made her first foray into the public eye less than two years ago.
title: Kim Jong Un’s Daughter Training For Succession, Seoul’s Spy Agency Says

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Weary Venezuelans Brace for More Tension Ahead

description: Several airlines have suspended services to Lebanon’s main international airport as tensions escalate between Israel and the Hezbollah militia group.
title: Airlines Cancel Flights to Lebanon as Mideast Tensions Escalate

description: South Africa is getting closer to publishing long-awaited changes to its financial rules and has earmarked over-the-counter derivatives for greater scrutiny, alongside unlisted financial market activity.
title: South Africa Mulls Tightening Over-The-Counter Derivative Rules

description: The US Treasury’s updated plans for debt sales, a signature event for bond dealers every quarter, now loom also as a politically sensitive one, after the Biden administration was accused by some Republicans of manipulating issuance tactics.
title: US Debt-Sale Plan Gets Politically Sensitive With Election Ahead

description: Malaysia’s former Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is recovering well and able to return home, according to his office.
title: Malaysia Ex-Premier Mahathir Recovering, Allowed Home, Aide Says

description: President Joe Biden will call for lawmakers to pass new binding ethics rules and term limits for Supreme Court justices on Monday as part of a sweeping proposal that would fundamentally alter the US’s top court.
title: Biden Calls for Strict New Limits on US Supreme Court Justices

description: The US and other world powers sought to prevent Israel and Hezbollah’s conflict turning into a full-blown war after Israel blamed the Lebanon-based group for an attack that killed several children.
title: Israel Weighs Response to Deadly Golan Strike as US Urges Calm

description: Japan expects to hit its primary balance goal in the year starting April 2025, finally achieving the long-standing goal for fiscal health after more than a decade of delays.
title: Japan Expects to Hit Primary Balance Goal After Decade of Delay

description: Bangladesh’s worst political violence since Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina extended her grip in power in January elections could cost the economy $10 billion, a major setback for the nation looking to shore up its foreign exchange reserves.
title: Shutdowns May Cost Bangladesh $10 Billion, Industry Group Says

description: The US has “serious concerns” about the results of the election in Venezuela, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, calling for a detailed tabulation of votes after Nicolás Maduro was reelected as the nation’s president for six more years.
title: Blinken Says US Has Serious Concerns on Venezuela Vote Results

description: Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said the “selfishness” of Hungary’s leader in dealing with European Union partners has left the country isolated and weakened, the latest sign of a widening diplomatic rift.
title: Poland’s Sikorski Slams Orban’s ‘Selfishness’ in Escalating Row

description: Venezuela’s electoral authority, controlled by the ruling regime, said Nicolás Maduro was reelected as the nation’s president for six more years, setting off what is likely to be a clash with opposition parties who believed their massive turnout drive would result in victory.
title: Maduro Named Winner of Venezuela Vote Despite Opposition Turnout

description: The Bank of England is likely to warn investors not to expect a string of back-to-back interest rate cuts if its policymakers push ahead with a first reduction in a knife-edge decision this week.
title: Bank of England May Kick Off Slow Cycle of Interest Rate Cuts

description: The results of Venezuela’s presidential election remain undisclosed more than four hours after polls began to close on Sunday in a widely attended vote that’s posed the greatest threat yet to Nicolás Maduro’s hold on power.
title: Venezuela Election Results Pending Hours After Tense Vote

description: Malaysia’s foreign ministry said Russia will back the Southeast Asian country’s application to join the BRICS economic bloc as Moscow looks to expand its influence into the Global South.
title: Malaysia Says BRICS Chair Russia Backs Its Bid to Join Bloc

description: Trump policies could further ignite the price of the metal already trading near record.
title: Gold, Not Dollar, Is the Best Trump Trade, Survey Shows
